items.title: NHTSA staffers evaluating self-driving car risks fired by DOGE
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Approximately 30 NHTSA staff were fired by Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) in February 2025.
- Affected staff were part of the office assessing self-driving car risks, raising concerns over diminished regulatory capabilities.
- The firings occurred amidst ongoing NHTSA investigations into Tesla's automated features, which have a high number of reported crashes.
- Victims' families have urged regulatory protections due to fears of reduced oversight under DOGE's influence.
- A new NHTSA framework easing regulation on self-driving cars was released before the firings, contingent on increased data sharing by companies.

items.title: Garmin’s new cycling headlight includes a 4K incident camera
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Garmin introduces the Varia Vue, a cycling headlight with a built-in 4K camera for incident recording.
- The device is priced at $549.99 and is available via Garmin's online store and Amazon.
- Features include up to six hours of 4K recording, electronic image stabilization, and the ability to upload videos to the Garmin Vault with a subscription.

items.title: OnePlus won’t say why its Watch 3 suddenly costs $170 more than promised
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- OnePlus Watch 3 price increased from $329.99 to $499, a markup of $170 or roughly 52%.
- The company has not communicated the reason for the price hike, with spokesperson stating no additional comments are available.
- Speculation suggests the price increase may be related to tariffs imposed by President Trump on products from China, with tariffs currently at 145%.

items.title: Vampire Survivors will let you share saves across platforms — but not on PlayStation
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Cross-saves for Vampire Survivors launched today but are not available on PlayStation due to a legal issue.
- Developer Poncle stated chances for PlayStation cross-saves are "very slim" but will continue working with Sony.
- Cross-saves available on Android, iOS, PC, and Xbox, with Nintendo Switch availability coming later.
- A new free DLC titled Emerald Diorama based on the SaGa franchise has also been released alongside a chicken-themed update.

items.title: Mike Flanagan is adapting Stephen King’s Carrie for Amazon
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Mike Flanagan is developing a series adaptation of Stephen King's *Carrie* for Amazon.
- The show will consist of eight episodes, with Flanagan serving as writer, showrunner, and director for some episodes.
- Actresses Summer H. Howell and Siena Agudong are reportedly in talks for the lead roles of Carrie White and Sue Snell.
- This adaptation follows numerous previous versions of *Carrie*, with the original film released in 1976.
- Flanagan has a strong history of adapting Stephen King's works, with notable projects including *Doctor Sleep* and *Gerald's Game*.

items.title: Canva is now in the coding and spreadsheet business
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Canva launches Visual Suite 2.0, integrating design and productivity tools.
- New features include coding, photo editing, spreadsheets, and AI assistance.
- Users can collaborate on documents, presentations, animations, and websites in a unified interface.
- Canva Sheets allows for creative spreadsheet creation and data visualization with AI.
- Canva Code acts as a generative AI assistant for coding tasks without traditional coding tools.
- New AI chatbot simplifies access to Canva's generative AI offerings for quick edits and content creation.

items.title: Sonos appoints software veteran Hugo Barra to its board after app troubles
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Sonos appoints Hugo Barra to its board of directors, replacing Mike Volpi, who served for 15 years.
- Barra has held senior positions at Google, Xiaomi, and Meta, and is currently the co-founder of /dev/agents.
- His addition is part of Sonos' strategy to improve its app and overall performance following previous issues.
- Sonos is also cancelling its upcoming streaming video player product codenamed Pinewood and focusing on other projects.

items.title: The best foldable phone you can buy
Trump's Tariffs Pause Could Help Nintendo Ship More Switch 2s
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- President Trump's 90-day pause on high tariffs may benefit Nintendo by allowing more shipments of the new Switch 2 from Vietnam to the US.
- Nintendo has been stockpiling Switch 2 units, ahead of its launch on June 5th, as customs data indicates increased shipments from Vietnam.
- Previously, a 46% tariff was placed on Vietnam, delaying Nintendo's planned preorders for April 9th in the US, but the current 10% tariff now applies to consoles shipped from Vietnam.

items.title: Sony is now selling both Last of Us games in one package
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The new Last of Us complete collection features enhanced PS5 versions of both games, aimed at new players following the HBO series.
- The downloadable version of the collection is available now, while the physical collector’s edition will release on July 10th.
- The physical edition includes a steelbook case, art prints, and comic books, and will be exclusive to PlayStation’s own shop.

items.title: Apple quickly shipped 600 tons of iPhones to ‘beat’ the new tariffs
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Apple airshipped 600 tons of iPhones to the US from India before new tariffs took effect.
- Approximately 1.5 million devices were shipped since March to avoid price increases.
- Apple lobbied for faster customs clearance and temporarily increased production by 20%. 
- Other companies like Dell, Microsoft, and Lenovo also rushed to ship premium devices before tariff deadlines.
- Some suppliers faced challenges in meeting the shipping demand in time for the tariffs.

items.title: The tariff apocalypse has not been canceled
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- President Trump implemented a series of tariffs against various countries, causing market reactions and delays on product preorders.
- A 90-day pause was announced, but many tariffs remain in effect, especially on goods from China, Canada, and Mexico.
- Tariffs range from 10% to 104% on goods, contributing to ongoing trade tensions and uncertainty in international relations.

items.title: Here come the e-bikes using DJI’s excellent Avinox drive system
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Several bicycle brands announced their first e-bikes using DJI’s Avinox drive system, including brands like Forbidden, Unno, Smartmotion, and Megamo.
- The Avinox drive system features a powerful 1000W motor capable of producing 120Nm of max torque.
- This is DJI's initial entry into the e-bike market, previously seen in a mid-drive electric mountain bike by Amflow.

items.title: Microsoft’s 50th birthday party sure was eventful
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft celebrated its 50th anniversary with a party featuring cofounders Bill Gates and Steve Ballmer along with current CEO Satya Nadella.
- Nadella showcased new GitHub Copilot features and reflected on Microsoft’s evolution from a developer tools company to a platform for all.
- A protest from Microsoft employee Ibtihal Aboussad disrupted the event, highlighting concerns over Microsoft’s contracts with the Israeli government.
- The event featured live entertainment and a talk show format, including Bill Gates discussing the company’s history and future.
- Protesters outside the venue raised further concerns during the event, with employee Vaniya Agrawal resigning after expressing discontent with leadership.

items.title: OpenAI gets ready to launch GPT-4.1
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- OpenAI is preparing to unveil new AI models, including GPT-4.1, next week.
- GPT-4.1 is described as a revamped version of the multimodal GPT-4o model, which integrates audio, vision, and text reasoning in real time.
- Along with GPT-4.1, smaller versions named GPT-4.1 mini and nano are also expected to be released soon.
- OpenAI's reasoning models, o3 and o4 mini, are anticipated to debut next week as well, potentially sooner for o4 mini based on recent discoveries in ChatGPT.
- Delays in model introductions have been hinted due to capacity issues affecting OpenAI's services, with CEO Sam Altman acknowledging expected slowdowns and delays for customers.

items.title: Why hundreds flock to play with decades-old computers
items.author: Andru Marino
items.summary:
- The Vintage Computer Festival East at InfoAge Science and History Museums attracts hundreds each April.
- Attendees engage with working vintage computers, unlike traditional museums where displays are not interactive.
- Festival features hands-on experiences with computers from the 1960s to modern devices, encouraging learning and sharing among tech enthusiasts.

items.title: Why DOGE is killing the agency that keeps banks from ripping you off
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
[Rohit Chopra was fired as director of the CFPB by Trump in January 2023.]
[The CFPB was established to protect consumers from predatory lending and has faced attempts to dismantle it by the Trump administration and Elon Musk's DOGE.]
[There is ongoing debate about the power of the Trump administration to shut down the CFPB, which was created by Congress, leading to significant controversies and impacts on financial regulation.]

items.title: There are several ways to save on a Google Pixel 9A
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The Google Pixel 9A is now available after a brief delay.
- Available for $100 or less with a trade-in at the [Google Store](https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/8836598/type/dlg/https://store.google.com/product/pixel_9a?hl=en-US) plus a $100 store credit until April 23rd.
- Many devices eligible for trade-in including Pixel Fold, iPhone 15 Pro, Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6.
- Offers available through carriers: free Pixel 9A with Google Fi, or low-cost deals from AT&T and Verizon.
- Expected availability at [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Google-Pixel-Gemini-Smartphone-Incredible/dp/B0DVJ11FP4?tag=theverge02-20) with June 1st delivery.
- Enhanced features include better water resistance and a bigger, brighter screen.

items.title: A UK edition of Saturday Night Live is premiering in 2026
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Sky Studios is developing a British adaptation of NBC’s Saturday Night Live, set to premiere in 2026.
- The show will be produced by Lorne Michaels, the original creator of SNL.
- It will offer a mix of comedy, political commentary, music, and guest hosts, similar to the US version.
- Specific details about the premiere date, hosts, and musical guests are yet to be announced.

items.title: How these guitar modeling companies are recreating rare vintage sounds for the digital age
items.author: Mack DeGeurin
items.summary:
- Dweezil Zappa faced challenges recreating his father Frank's sounds on tour without original equipment.
- He discovered guitar amp modelers, which digitally replicate sounds for portability and creativity.
- The digital amp market has advanced, catering to professional musicians and live performances.
- Two main types of technology: amp profilers (snapshot sounds) and amp modelers (detailed simulations).
- Digital modelers can closely mimic analog amps, offering tonal richness and creative possibilities.
- Major companies include Fractal Audio, Line 6, Neural DSP, and Kemper.
- Continuous advancements have improved audio fidelity, though latency issues remain.

items.title: What’s on your desk, Allison Johnson?
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Allison Johnson is a smartphone reviewer at The Verge, previously working at DPReview, focusing on digital and smartphone cameras.
- Her desk is in the bedroom of her home, where she works full-time with her husband and toddler.
- The desk is a mini desk from West Elm, which was received amidst chaos during lockdown.
- She uses an Ikea chair with a comfortable footrest from Cushion Lab, providing support during work hours.
- Organized cords with stick-on cord holders and uses multiple chargers for Android and iOS devices.
- Tech setup includes a company-issued M1 MacBook Air, Logitech Pebble keyboard, and a sturdy Rain Design laptop stand.
- She has a reliable Brother laser printer, used primarily for shipping labels.
- Keeps multiple phone review units for comparison and organizes them in a designated storage stand.
- Enjoys using a Moleskine notebook and has a lamp from Ikea that provides essential light during the winter.

items.title: Big Tech’s tax bill is on the table in tariff talks
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- The UK is considering lowering the Digital Services Tax (DST) as part of trade negotiations with the US to counter tariffs imposed by President Trump.
- Prime Minister Keir Starmer confirmed trade discussions have included the taxation of digital services.
- The DST currently taxes large tech companies at a rate of 2% based on UK user revenue and has collected £358 million in the 2020-2021 tax year.
- There is speculation that weakening the DST could negatively impact similar taxes worldwide, as more than a dozen countries have introduced comparable levies.
- Trump's administration considers the DST 'extortive' and is leveraging tariffs to address what it sees as discrimination against American companies.
- Negotiations involve potential concessions including reduced tax rates and eligibility thresholds for the DST and other trade concessions such as tariffs on US beef and chicken.

items.title: Flipper Zero Creators Launch Busy Bar for Reducing Work Distractions
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The creators of the Flipper Zero have introduced a new tool called the [Busy Bar](https://busy.bar/preview) designed to boost productivity and minimize distractions.
- The Busy Bar features a customizable LED pixelated display and functions as a timer with an eight-hour battery.
- Users can set statuses like 'busy' or 'on call' and automate notifications based on their schedule through mobile and desktop apps.
- It can secure smart locks, adjust lighting, and manage notifications to help maintain focus.
- The Busy Bar is launching via [Kickstarter](https://www.kickstarter.com/) at a price of $189.

items.title: Google Pixel 9A review: a midrange phone done right
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The Pixel 9A is priced at $499, making it competitively affordable compared to other midrange options.
- It features a robust IP68 rating, seven years of software updates, and a brighter, larger 6.3-inch screen.
- The replacement of the camera design to a flush back panel adds a distinctive look.
- The Pixel 9A has a 5,100mAh battery, claimed to have the best battery life of any Pixel phone in extreme battery saver mode.
- It runs on Google's custom Tensor G4 chipset and 8GB of RAM, ensuring responsive performance for most applications.
- The camera system includes a 48MP main and a 13MP ultrawide camera, but it struggles in low light and has limitations compared to pricier models.
- Overall, the Pixel 9A offers a solid experience with only minor drawbacks noticeable due to its price range.

items.title: Black Mirror has a clever new game tied to season 7
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Netflix has released a new game called **Thronglets** alongside season 7 of *Black Mirror*, specifically related to the episode titled **Plaything**.
- In the game, players care for sentient creatures known as the **throng**, managing their needs and watching them replicate.
- Thronglets incorporates a meta layer, with creatures asking for advice and raising existential questions, contributing to a darker and surreal experience.
- The game is available for free for Netflix subscribers on [iOS](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.netflix.com%2Fgame%2F81767501) and [Android](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.netflix.com%2Fgame%2F81767501).

items.title: Black Mirror season 7 tugs at your heartstrings while skewering tech
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The new season of *Black Mirror* shifts focus from dark tech critiques to more human narratives, featuring episodes with happy endings.
- In "Hotel Reverie," a tech startup's immersive film remake leads to a poignant connection between characters.
- "Eulogy" explores a man's memories of his ex-girlfriend through VR technology, highlighting the bittersweet nature of relationships.
- "Common People" addresses the burdens of escalating subscription costs in a humorous but relatable context.
- Season 7 includes more connective elements to past episodes, featuring sequels to major hits like "Bandersnatch" and "USS Callister."

items.title: Oppo’s Find X8 Ultra squeezes better specs into a slightly thinner phone
items.author: Dominic Preston

items.title: Judge berates AI entrepreneur for using a generated ‘lawyer’ in court
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Jerome Dewald, a 74-year-old entrepreneur, used an AI-generated avatar in a New York courtroom for his legal appeal.
- The avatar, named Jim, was not disclosed as artificial, leading to confusion during the court proceedings on March 26th.
- Justice Sallie Manzanet-Daniels reprimanded Dewald, stating he misled the court and warned against using the courtroom as a platform for his business.
- This incident follows previous issues where legal processes have been impacted by AI technology, including attorneys penalized for using AI-generated fictitious legal research.

items.title: China will show fewer US films in response to tariffs
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- China will cut the number of American films imported as a response to increased US tariffs imposed by the Trump administration.
- The Chinese Film Administration stated that higher tariffs (up to 125%) are a 'wrong move' that will decrease favorability towards US films.
- China aims to respect market rules while meeting domestic demand with more global films, amid speculation of a potential ban on US film imports.

items.title: ChargePoint’s new Level 2 chargers are faster and go both ways
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- ChargePoint revealed new AC Level 2 EV chargers that double the speed of typical units.
- The chargers are rated for 90 amps, delivering 19.2kW, charging EVs from 0 to 100% in about 4 hours.
- New chargers support bidirectional charging, allowing EVs to power homes or businesses.
- ChargePoint plans to start rolling out these chargers in Europe this summer and North America by the end of the year.
- Prices will start below $1,000, varying with the model.
- The chargers will feature dynamic load balancing and will integrate with smart home systems control.

items.title: Waymo readies autonomous cars for first international tests in Japan
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Waymo will begin testing driverless vehicles on public roads in Japan next week, marking its first international trip.
- The tests aim to collect data on local driving nuances, such as left-hand traffic and urban navigation, with vehicles being managed by local operator Nihon Kotsu.
- About 25 vehicles have arrived, and trained drivers will manually navigate them across seven Tokyo wards for data collection.
- Waymo has been training local taxi drivers and coordinating with officials for these tests, emphasizing safety and collaboration.
- Waymo currently operates robotaxi services in cities like San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Phoenix and plans further expansions in various US locations.

items.title: OpenAI countersues Elon Musk to stop his attacks and ‘fake takeover bid’
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- OpenAI filed a countersuit against Elon Musk, claiming his actions are bad-faith tactics aimed at disrupting the company.
- The lawsuit demands Musk cease unlawful actions and be held accountable for damages he has caused.
- Musk previously sued OpenAI for abandoning its mission focused on human benefit, but later dropped that case.
- The case is set to go to trial in spring 2026.
- Earlier this year, Musk proposed a $97.4 billion acquisition of OpenAI, which was rejected as a sham bid.

items.title: Lawmakers are skeptical of Zuckerberg’s commitment to free speech
items.author: Lauren Feiner

items.title: How to choose which Apple Watch to buy
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- New Apple Watch Series 9, 10, and Ultra 2 units sold in the US no longer have the blood oxygen feature due to a patent dispute with Masimo.
- The article discusses various models including Series SE, Series 10, and Ultra, highlighting features and target audiences.
- Apple Watch Series 10 offers a larger display, thinner design, new FDA-cleared sleep apnea feature, and comes in new colors and materials.
- Buying refurbished models is recommended to save costs, especially for features like blood oxygen monitoring.
- The SE model is suggested for younger or first-time buyers, while the Ultra is recommended for serious athletes and outdoor enthusiasts.

items.title: Adobe is building AI agents for Photoshop and Premiere Pro
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Adobe is developing AI agents for Photoshop and Premiere Pro to assist with photo and video editing tasks.
- Photoshop's AI, termed 'creative agent', will suggest context-aware edits, allowing automatic execution of tasks through a new Actions panel.
- Users can interact with the agent using natural language and receive guidance on complex editing steps.
- Premiere Pro's agents will enhance Media Intelligence features for video composition, aiding in rough edits and additional tasks.
- The first AI agent for Photoshop will be showcased at Adobe's Max event in London on April 24th.

items.title: Aqara adds support for 50 new Matter device types
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Aqara is adding support for over 50 new Matter device types, making it a leading smart home platform in terms of Matter support.
- The update introduces advanced bridging that integrates Aqara's automation features with Matter-compatible platforms like Apple Home, Amazon Alexa, and Google Home.
- New supported device types include robotic vacuums, smoke alarms, air quality sensors, and many others, expanding beyond already supported sensors, switches, and lights.
- The update will rollout with Aqara Home version 5.1.9 and Matter Controller firmware version 4.3.5 later this month.
- Advanced bridging allows Matter devices to integrate into platforms that don’t yet support certain device types, enhancing interoperability within smart home environments.

items.title: Framework’s entry-level modular Laptop 12 starts at £499
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The Framework Laptop 12 is a 12-inch modular 2-in-1 touchscreen PC, available for pre-order at £499 in the UK.
- Prices rise to £749 for a model with 8GB RAM and 512GB storage, with an additional cost for upgrading specs.
- Production issues due to tariffs led to delays in US preorders and certain sales being paused; the company emphasizes repairability and modularity.
- Expected shipping dates are June for DIY models and July for prebuilt models; only black color is available for the latter initially.

items.title: Trump says the future of AI is powered by coal
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary:
- Trump signed an executive order to promote coal production ahead of a congressional hearing on energy needs for the AI industry.
- The order directs studies on using coal for powering AI data centers, citing a need for increased energy supply.
- AI industry leaders express urgent demand for reliable energy sources, projecting data centers could consume 9.1% of US energy by 2030.
- Despite Trump's coal promotion, the coal industry has declined, providing 15% of US energy today, down from nearly half in 2011.
- Ethical concerns arise for AI leaders promoting green energy while relying on coal, as the industry seeks sustainable alternatives.

items.title: Framework raised prices and then un-raised them an hour later because of Trump
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- President Trump's tariffs went into effect at 12:01 AM ET on Wednesday, including high tariffs on imports from China and Taiwan.
- Framework announced a 10% price increase for its computers at 12:30 PM ET due to the tariffs.
- At 1:18 PM ET, Trump announced a 90-day tariff pause for most countries, leading Framework to reverse its price increase by 1:48 PM ET.
- Framework also delayed the launch of its new Framework Laptop 12 preorders in the US and temporarily halted sales of some lower-priced laptop configurations.
- The company emphasized its transparency and commitment to absorb some costs related to tariffs while mentioning ongoing challenges due to the complex tariff landscape.

items.title: Gemini can now turn your Google Docs into podcasts
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Google introduced new Gemini features for Google Docs, including AI-generated podcasts.
- The podcast feature, which has been available in Google’s NotebookLM and Gemini app, will provide audio overviews in Google Docs and AI narration.
- Another upcoming feature includes an AI suggestion tool to refine document drafts, expected later this quarter.
- Future enhancements for Sheets will include an AI feature to help analyze and visualize data, coming later this year.

items.title: Smart home device manufacturers are bracing for chaos — again
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- President Trump's new tariffs include a 125% levy on Chinese imports, affecting the smart home industry.
- Device manufacturers are already struggling due to previous tariffs, increased competition, and slow demand.
- Companies like iRobot and Brilliant have faced difficulties due to rising tariffs and supply chain challenges.
- Most smart home companies source products from China, complicating manufacturing shifts to other countries like Vietnam.
- New tariffs create uncertainty, making it hard for companies to invest in U.S. factories.
- Higher consumer costs may limit market entry for smart home products, as affordability is a major barrier for potential buyers.
- Price increases for smart home devices are anticipated, impacting purchasing decisions.

items.title: One of our favorite video doorbells is on sale for $80
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- TP-Link’s Tapo D225 Video Doorbell Camera is on sale for $79.99, a $20 discount.
- Features include recording to a microSD, smart alerts for people, pets, and packages, and phone calls when someone presses the doorbell.
- It offers a wide 180-degree field of view and does not require subscription fees, making it a great value below $100.

items.title: Trump announces a ’90-day pause’ on tariffs outside of China
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 90-day pause on certain tariffs and a reduction to 10% for countries not retaliating against US tariffs.
- He raised tariffs on China to 125% in response to their recent tariffs on US goods.
- The new tariff level, if implemented, signifies a substantial decrease for many countries exporting to the US, including Vietnam.

items.title: Teenage Engineering has updated its KO II synthesizer with new sampling powers
items.author: Andrew Liszewski

items.title: The best AirPods to buy
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Apple offers four AirPods models with unique advantages: AirPods Pro, AirPods 4 (with and without noise cancellation), and AirPods Max.
- AirPods Pro provides excellent noise cancellation, sound quality, and hearing health features, priced at $219.
- AirPods 4 is recommended for users averse to ear tips, priced at $117, but lacks wireless charging.
- AirPods Max, priced at $500, features a luxurious design and superior sound quality but is heavy and lacks some newer features.

items.title: The best AirPods to buy
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- The article reviews various AirPods models suitable for different preferences, including the AirPods Pro, AirPods 4, and AirPods Max.
- Highlights the features such as noise cancellation, sound quality, and integration with Apple devices.
- Discusses pricing: AirPods Pro at $219, AirPods 4 from $117, and AirPods Max at $500.
- Emphasizes the unique selling points of the AirPods Pro, including health features and precise location tracking.

items.title: WordPress.com is offering a new AI site builder
items.author: Umar Shakir

items.title: The Switch 2's Joy-Con charging grip has two extra buttons
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- The Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip features two extra remappable back buttons (GL and GR).
- Priced at $34.99, it is a cheaper alternative to the $79.99 Pro Controller.
- Scheduled to launch on June 5th alongside the Nintendo Switch 2, which has delayed preorders in the US and Canada.

items.title: You can now give Google's AI video model camera directions
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google introduces new features for its video AI model, Veo 2, allowing users to create cinematic footage and edit real videos.
- New capabilities include inpainting for removing unwanted backgrounds and outpainting to extend video frames with AI-generated content.
- Cinematic technique presets have been added to guide shot composition, camera angles, and pacing.
- An interpolation feature allows transitions between still images, enhancing video continuity.
- Veo 2's updates aim to compete with Adobe's generative AI tools, which offer similar functionalities.
- Both Veo 2 and Imagen 3 are utilized by companies like L’Oreal and Kraft Heinz to streamline content creation, reducing production time significantly.
- Google has launched its text-to-music model, Lyria, and improved its synthetic speech model, Chirp 3, to generate realistic voices and clearer transcriptions.

items.title: Why I love Twinkly Strings and Twinkly Flex
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Jess Weatherbed discovered Twinkly Strings while seeking customizable Christmas lights from a family friend's garden setup.
- Installation is user-friendly, requiring just Wi-Fi pairing, with reliable usage without frequent re-setup.
- Twinkly Strings and Flex light strips provide vibrant, customizable decor options for year-round use and are integrated with smart home routines.
- Complaints include the large power adapter plug and a desire for translucent cables for aesthetic matching.
- Recommended for anyone wanting effective and versatile lighting solutions, as the original set of Strings has lasted over five years intact.
